world

Interface Reportable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Reporter

    public interface Reportable
    Classes implementing Reportable can produce a more detailed and appropriately formatted report than is practicable with toString(). The report is likely to be written to System.out in many cases but other streams may be used (e.g. to print to a file). The output destination is set to a PrintWriter (which may in turn be constructed from a PrintStream).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andrew Dallow

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void report()
      Write the report to the appropriate output stream or file.
      void setDestination(PrintStream printStream)
      Set output destination to a PrintStream (e.g., System.out).
      void setDestination(PrintWriter printWriter)
      Set output destination to a PrintWrinter (e.g., a file).

    • Method Detail

      • report

        void report()
        Write the report to the appropriate output stream or file. The destination should be set as required and then its print/println methods can be used.

      • setDestination

        void setDestination(PrintStream printStream)
        Set output destination to a PrintStream (e.g., System.out).
        Parameters:
        printStream - A PrintStream to use.

      • setDestination

        void setDestination(PrintWriter printWriter)
        Set output destination to a PrintWrinter (e.g., a file).
        Parameters:
        printWriter - A PrintWriter to use.
